summary.span: 定义所有代码访问权限的基础结构。

span.span: Defines the underlying structure of all code access permissions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 代码访问权限使用堆栈审核来确保已为代码的所有调用方授予了权限。Code access permissions use a stack walk to ensure that all callers of the code have been granted a permission. 如果 `null`权限对象，则会将其处理方式与状态为 的权限对象相同。If a permission object is `null`, it is handled the same as a permission object with the state . 调用堆栈通常表示为向下增长，因此调用堆栈中较高位置的方法调用堆栈中较低的调用方法。The call stack is typically represented as growing down, so that methods higher in the call stack call methods lower in the call stack. 必须将 类的继承者授予完全信任，才能作为权限扩展安全基础结构。Inheritors of the class must be granted full trust to function correctly as permissions extending the security infrastructure. 若要确定继承者是完全受信任的， = `true` 和 = `true`发出 。To determine that the inheritors are fully trusted, issues an for = `true` and = `true`. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示一个派生自 类的权限。The following code example shows a permission derived from the class. [!code-cpp[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/CPP/nameidpermission.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/CS/nameidpermission.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/VB/nameidpermission.vb#1)]

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 每当创建派生类的实例时，都将调用此构造函数来初始化类型中的状态。This constructor is called to initialize state in the type whenever an instance of the derived class is created. 尽管可以在派生类构造函数的构造函数声明中显式调用此构造函数，但这通常是不必要的;大多数编译器会自动为你生成调用。Although you can explicitly call this constructor in the constructor declaration of the derived class constructor, this is not usually necessary; most compilers will automatically generate the call for you.

summary.span: 声明调用代码能够通过调用此方法的代码，访问受权限请求保护的资源，即使未对堆栈中处于较高位置的调用方授予访问该资源的权限。

span.span: Declares that the calling code can access the resource protected by a permission demand through the code that calls this method, even if callers higher in the stack have not been granted permission to access the resource.

summary.span: 使用 会引起安全问题。

span.span: Using can create security issues.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用堆栈通常表示为向下增长，因此调用堆栈中较高位置的方法调用堆栈中较低的调用方法。The call stack is typically represented as growing down, so that methods higher in the call stack call methods lower in the call stack. 调用 会阻止调用堆栈中的堆栈遍历在调用堆栈之外的堆栈遍历超出调用此方法的代码。Calling prevents a stack walk originating lower in the call stack from proceeding up the call stack beyond the code that calls this method. 因此，即使调用堆栈中较高位置的调用方没有访问资源所需的权限，它们仍可以通过对所需权限调用此方法的代码来访问它。Therefore, even if callers higher on the call stack do not have the requisite permissions to access a resource, they can still access it through the code that calls this method on the necessary permission. 仅当调用 的代码为它断言的权限传递安全检查时，断言才有效。An assertion is effective only if the code that calls passes the security check for the permission that it is asserting. 对 的调用在调用代码返回到其调用方之前有效。The call to is effective until the calling code returns to its caller. 帧上只有一个 可以处于活动状态。Only one can be active on a frame. 当帧上存在活动 导致 时，尝试调用 。An attempt to call when an active exists on the frame results in a . 调用 或 以删除活动 。Call or to remove an active . 对于未授予的权限，将忽略 ，因为对该权限的请求将不会成功。 is ignored for a permission not granted because a demand for that permission will not succeed. 但是，如果调用堆栈上的代码越低，就会为该权限调用 ，当堆栈遍历到达尝试调用 的代码时，将引发 。However, if code lower on the call stack calls for that permission, a is thrown when the stack walk reaches the code that tried to call . 发生这种情况的原因是，未授予调用 的代码的权限，即使它尝试 它也是如此。This happens because the code that called has not been granted the permission, even though it tried to it. > [!CAUTION] > 由于调用 不再要求调用链中的所有代码都必须被授予访问指定资源的权限，因此如果使用不当或不当，则会导致安全问题。Because calling removes the requirement that all code in the call chain must be granted permission to access the specified resource, it can open up security issues if used incorrectly or inappropriately. 因此，使用它时要格外小心。Therefore, it should be used with great caution.

exception.span: 调用代码没有 。

A copy of the current permission object.

summary.span: 如果未对调用堆栈中处于较高位置的所有调用方授予当前实例所指定的权限，则在运行时强制 。

span.span: Forces a at run time if all callers higher in the call stack have not been granted the permission specified by the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法通常由安全库用于确保调用方有权访问资源。This method is typically used by secure libraries to ensure that callers have permission to access a resource. 例如，在执行调用方请求的文件操作之前，安全类库中的文件类将为必要的 调用 。For example, a file class in a secure class library calls for the necessary before performing a file operation requested by the caller. 不检查调用此方法的代码的权限;该检查从该代码的直接调用方开始，并沿堆栈向上进行。The permissions of the code that calls this method are not examined; the check begins from the immediate caller of that code and proceeds up the stack. 调用堆栈通常表示为向下增长，因此调用堆栈中较高位置的方法调用堆栈中较低的调用方法。The call stack is typically represented as growing down, so that methods higher in the call stack call methods lower in the call stack. 仅当未引发 时， 才会成功。 succeeds only if no is raised.

exception.span: 调用堆栈中处于较高位置的调用方不具有当前实例所指定的权限。

span.span: A caller higher in the call stack does not have the permission specified by the current instance.
-or-

exception.span: 调用堆栈中处于较高位置的调用方已经对当前权限对象调用了 。

span.span: A caller higher in the call stack has called on the current permission object.
You cannot override this method.

summary.span: 防止处于调用堆栈较高位置的调用函数使用可以调用此方法来访问当前实例指定资源的代码。

span.span: Prevents callers higher in the call stack from using the code that calls this method to access the resource specified by the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > 应仅使用 方法来防止完全受信任的代码意外访问资源。The method should be used only to protect resources from accidental access by fully trusted code. 不应使用它来防止不受信任的代码有意滥用资源。It should not be used to protect resources from intentional misuse by untrusted code. 例如，如果方法 `A` 为权限发出 ，然后调用方法 `B`，则方法 `B` 可以通过发出 来 overtly 重写 。For example, if method `A` issues a for a permission and then calls method `B`, method `B` can overtly override the by issuing an . 调用的方法在堆栈中始终更高。The called method is always higher in the stack. 因此，如果方法 `B` 尝试访问受保护的资源，则安全系统会开始检查其权限，因为方法 `B` 是直接调用方，然后向下遍历堆栈，以确认堆栈中没有 或 低于。Therefore, if method `B` tries to access a protected resource, the security system begins checking for permissions with it because method `B` is the immediate caller, and then walks down the stack to confirm that there is no or lower in the stack. 尝试访问资源的方法 `B`可通过使用 方法立即停止堆栈遍历。Method `B`, which is trying to access the resource, can stop the stack walk immediately by using the method. 在这种情况下，永远不会发现通过方法 `A` （调用方法）放置在堆栈上的 。In that case, the placed on the stack by method `A` (the calling method) is never discovered. 此方法阻止调用堆栈中较高位置的调用方通过调用此方法的代码访问受保护的资源，即使这些调用方已被授予访问该方法的权限。This method prevents callers higher in the call stack from accessing the protected resource through the code that calls this method, even if those callers have been granted permission to access it. 调用堆栈通常表示为向下增长，因此调用堆栈中较高位置的方法调用堆栈中较低的调用方法。The call stack is typically represented as growing down, so that methods higher in the call stack call methods lower in the call stack. 可以限制程序员的责任，或帮助防止意外的安全问题，因为它有助于防止调用 的方法访问由拒绝的权限保护的资源。 can limit the liability of the programmer or help prevent accidental security issues because it helps prevent the method that calls from being used to access the resource protected by the denied permission. 如果方法对权限调用 ，并且调用堆栈中的调用方调用了该权限的 ，则该安全检查在到达 时将失败。If a method calls on a permission, and if a for that permission is invoked by a caller lower in the call stack, that security check will fail when it reaches the . 对 的调用在调用代码返回到其调用方之前有效。The call to is effective until the calling code returns to its caller. 帧上只有一个 可以处于活动状态。Only one can be active on a frame. 当帧上存在活动 导致 时，尝试调用 。An attempt to call when an active exists on the frame results in a . 调用 或 以删除活动 。Call or to remove an active . 对于未授予的权限，将忽略 ，因为对该权限的请求将不会成功。 is ignored for a permission not granted because a demand for that permission will not succeed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 同一权限的两个实例的哈希代码可能不同，因此，不应使用哈希代码来比较两个 的对象。The hash code for two instances of the same permission might be different, hence a hash code should not be used to compare two objects.

span.span: This new permission is if the intersection is empty.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 两个权限的交集是描述它们共同描述的一组操作的权限。The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the set of operations they both describe in common. 只有同时传递两个原始权限的请求才会传递交集。Only a demand that passes both original permissions will pass the intersection. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示 方法的重写。The following code example shows an override of the method. 此代码示例是为 类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. Public MustOverride Function IsSubsetOf (target As IPermission) As Boolean

param.name: target
param.span: 将要测试子集关系的权限。

span.span: A permission that is to be tested for the subset relationship.

param.span: 此权限必须与当前权限属于同一类型。

span.span: This permission must be of the same type as the current permission.

summary.span: 由派生类实现时，确定当前权限是否为指定权限的子集。

span.span: When implemented by a derived class, determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.

returns.span: 如果当前权限是指定权限的子集，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果当前权限指定的一组操作完全包含在指定权限中，则当前权限是指定权限的子集。The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the current permission specifies a set of operations that is wholly contained by the specified permission. 例如，表示对 C:\example.txt 的访问权限的权限是表示对 C：\\的访问权限的一个子集。For example, a permission that represents access to C:\example.txt is a subset of a permission that represents access to C:\\. 如果此方法返回 `true`，则当前权限表示对受保护资源的访问权限比指定权限更多。If this method returns `true`, the current permission represents no more access to the protected resource than does the specified permission. 对于 方法的所有重写，都需要 `true` 以下语句。The following statements are required to be `true` for all overrides of the method. *X*、 *Y*和*Z*表示自定义代码访问权限对象，这些权限对象不是空引用， *U*表示不受限制的代码访问权限，而*N*表示 为 的空权限。*X*, *Y*, and *Z* represent custom code access permission objects that are not null references, *U* represents an unrestricted code access permission, and *N* represents an empty permission with a of . - *X*。IsSubsetOf （*X*）将返回 `true`。*X*.IsSubsetOf(*X*) returns `true`. - *X*。IsSubsetOf （*y*）返回与*Y*相同的值。当且仅当*X*和*Y*表示相同权限集时，IsSubsetOf （*X*）。*X*.IsSubsetOf(*Y*) returns the same value as *Y*.IsSubsetOf(*X*) if and only if *X* and *Y* represent the same set of permissions. - 如果为*X*IsSubsetOf （*y*）和*Y*。IsSubsetOf （*Z*）返回 `true`， *X*。IsSubsetOf （*Z*）返回 `true`。If *X*.IsSubsetOf(*Y*) and *Y*.IsSubsetOf(*Z*) both return `true`, *X*.IsSubsetOf(*Z*) returns `true`. - *X*。IsSubsetOf （*U*）返回 `true`。*X*.IsSubsetOf(*U*) returns `true`. - *X*。IsSubsetOf （*N*）返回 `false`。*X*.IsSubsetOf(*N*) returns `false`. - *N*。IsSubsetOf （*X*）将返回 `true`。*N*.IsSubsetOf(*X*) returns `true`. 如果*x*和*Y*表示自定义代码访问权限对象，这些权限对象为空引用*X*。IsSubsetOf （*Y*）返回 `true`。If *X* and *Y* represent custom code access permission objects that are null references, *X*.IsSubsetOf(*Y*) returns `true`. 如果*Z*也为 null，则为复合集运算*X*。Union （*Y*）。IsSubsetOf （*Z*）还返回 `true`，因为两个 null 权限的联合是 null 权限。If *Z* is also null, the compound set operation *X*.Union(*Y*).IsSubsetOf(*Z*) also returns `true` because the union of two null permissions is a null permission. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示 方法的重写。The following code example shows an override of the method. 此代码示例是为 类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. [!code-cpp[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/CPP/nameidpermission.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/CS/nameidpermission.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.NameIdPermission/VB/nameidpermission.vb#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void PermitOnly() cil managed
abstract member PermitOnly : unit -> unit override this.PermitOnly : unit -> unit
.method public hidebysig instance void PermitOnly() cil managed

summary.span: 防止处于调用堆栈较高位置的调用函数使用此代码，此代码将调用此方法来访问除当前实例指定的资源以外的所有资源。

span.span: Prevents callers higher in the call stack from using the code that calls this method to access all resources except for the resource specified by the current instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > 应仅使用 方法来防止完全受信任的代码意外访问资源。The method should be used only to protect resources from accidental access by fully trusted code. 不应使用它来防止不受信任的代码有意滥用资源。It should not be used to protect resources from intentional misuse by untrusted code. 例如，如果方法 `A` 为权限发出 ，然后调用方法 `B`，则方法 `B` 可以通过发出 来 overtly 重写 。For example, if method `A` issues a for a permission and then calls method `B`, method `B` can overtly override the by issuing an . 调用的方法在堆栈中始终更高。The called method is always higher in the stack. 因此，如果方法 `B` 尝试访问受保护的资源，则安全系统会开始检查其权限，因为方法 `B` 是直接调用方，然后向下遍历堆栈，以确认堆栈中没有 或 低于。Therefore, if method `B` tries to access a protected resource, the security system begins checking for permissions with it because method `B` is the immediate caller, and then walks down the stack to confirm that there is no or lower in the stack. 尝试访问资源的方法 `B`可通过使用 方法立即停止堆栈遍历。Method `B`, which is trying to access the resource, can stop the stack walk immediately by using the method. 在这种情况下，永远不会发现通过方法 `A` （调用方法）放置在堆栈上的 。In that case, the placed on the stack by method `A` (the calling method) is never discovered. 类似于 ，因为在这两个情况下，堆栈遍历将会失败。 is similar to , in that both cause stack walks to fail when they would otherwise succeed. 不同之处在于 指定将导致堆栈遍历失败的权限，但 指定不会导致堆栈遍历失败的唯一权限。The difference is that specifies permissions that will cause the stack walk to fail, but specifies the only permissions that do not cause the stack walk to fail. 调用此方法以确保你的代码只能用于访问指定的资源。Call this method to ensure that your code can be used to access only the specified resources. 对 的调用在调用代码返回到其调用方之前有效。The call to is effective until the calling code returns to its caller. 帧上只有一个 可以处于活动状态。Only one can be active on a frame. 当帧上存在活动 导致 时，尝试调用 。An attempt to call when an active exists on the frame results in a . 调用 或 以删除活动 。Call or to remove an active . 对于未授予的权限，将忽略 ，因为对该权限的请求将不会成功。 is ignored for a permission not granted because a demand for that permission will not succeed. 但是，如果调用堆栈上的代码越小，稍后将对该权限调用 ，当堆栈遍历到达尝试调用 的代码时，将引发 。However, if code lower on the call stack later calls for that permission, a is thrown when the stack walk reaches the code that tried to call . 这是因为未授予调用 的代码的权限，即使该代码为该权限调用了 。This is because the code that called has not been granted the permission, even though it called for that permission. 调用堆栈通常表示为向下增长，因此调用堆栈中较高位置的方法调用堆栈中较低的调用方法。The call stack is typically represented as growing down, so that methods higher in the call stack call methods lower in the call stack.

exception.span: 已存在一个用于当前帧的活动的 。

span.span: There is already an active for the current frame.
You cannot override this method.

summary.span: 创建并返回当前权限对象的字符串表示形式。

span.span: Creates and returns a string representation of the current permission object.

returns.span: 当前权限对象的字符串表示形式。

span.span: A string representation of the current permission object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当你需要以字符串形式显示权限时，此方法可用于调试。This method is useful in debugging when you need to display the permission as a string.

summary.span: 当在派生类中重写时，创建安全对象及其当前状态的 XML 编码。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.

returns.span: 安全对象的 XML 编码，包括任何状态信息。

span.span: An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 扩展安全对象的自定义代码需要实现 和 方法，以使对象 encodable。Custom code that extends security objects needs to implement the and methods to make the objects security-encodable. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示 方法的重写。The following code example shows an override of the method. 此代码示例是为 类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. param.span: 与当前权限合并的权限。

span.span: A permission to combine with the current permission.

param.span: 它必须与当前权限属于同一类型。

span.span: It must be of the same type as the current permission.

summary.span: 当在派生类中重写时，则创建属于当前权限与指定权限的并集的权限。

span.span: When overridden in a derived class, creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

returns.span: 表示同时兼具当前权限和指定权限的新权限。

span.span: A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用 的结果是一个权限，它表示当前权限和指定权限所表示的所有操作。The result of a call to is a permission that represents all the operations represented by both the current permission and the specified permission. 任何传递任意权限的需求都将传递其联合。Any demand that passes either permission passes their union. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示 方法的重写。The following code example shows an override of the method. 此代码示例是为 类提供的更大示例的一部分。This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class.
